Based on data reported by over 4,000 weather stations

Earthquake activity:

Bovill-area historical earthquake activity is significantly above Idaho state average. It is 1020% greater than the overall U.S. average.

On 10/28/1983 at 14:06:06, a magnitude 7.3 (6.2 MB, 7.3 MS, 7.0 MW, Class: Major, Intensity: VIII - XII) earthquake occurred 229.9 miles away from the city center, causing 2 deaths (2 shaking deaths) and 3 injuries, causing $15,000,000 total damage

On 8/18/1959 at 06:37:13, a magnitude 7.7 (7.7 UK) earthquake occurred 319.3 miles away from Bovill center, causing $26,000,000 total damage

On 3/31/2020 at 23:52:30, a magnitude 6.5 (6.5 MW, Depth: 7.5 mi, Class: Strong, Intensity: VII - IX) earthquake occurred 176.8 miles away from the city center

On 4/13/1949 at 19:55:42, a magnitude 7.0 (7.0 UK) earthquake occurred 288.9 miles away from the city center, causing $80,000,000 total damage

On 10/3/1915 at 06:52:48, a magnitude 7.6 (7.6 UK) earthquake occurred 443.3 miles away from Bovill center

On 2/28/2001 at 18:54:32, a magnitude 6.8 (6.5 MB, 6.6 MS, 6.8 MW) earthquake occurred 292.3 miles away from the city center, causing $2,000,000,000 total damage and $305,000,000 insured losses

Magnitude types: body-wave magnitude (MB), surface-wave magnitude (MS), moment magnitude (MW)
